original: @1b #// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
analyzed: @1b #// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya don dgu pa //
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya don dgu pa //
translated: Volume 209

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: Subhūti, when I look with my buddha-eye at the world,

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa rnams kyi yi @2a *//
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa rnams kyi yi @2a *//
translated: I see bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the eastern direction in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River,🔽who pacify all the sufferings that exist in those realms of hungry ghosts, and teach the Dharma to abandon stinginess,

original: dvags kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad rab tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dvags kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: dvags kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad rab tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dvags kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /
translated: and the beings in those realms of hungry ghosts who generate a loving mind towards those bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: yi dvags kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag yi dvags kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
analyzed: yi dvags kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag yi dvags kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
translated: and when they have emerged from those animal wombs, those animal birthplaces, those animal abodes, those animal existences, by means of that wholesome root they are reborn in the world of the gods or in the human world,

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs @2b su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs @2b su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
translated: and until they have fully known the utmost, right and perfect enlightenment, they are never again deprived of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: rab 'byor ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, having looked with my buddha-eye,

original: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa rnams kyi yi dgas kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad rab
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa rnams kyi yi dgas kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad rab
translated: I see bodhisattva great beings in the southern direction in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, who, in those animal wombs, those animal birthplaces, those animal abodes, those animal existences, by means of that wholesome root are reborn in the world of the gods or in the human world,🔽and until they have fully known the utmost, right and perfect enlightenment, they are never again deprived of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /🔽yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dag pa'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig @3a *//
analyzed: tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing / yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dag pa'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig @3a *//
translated: And those beings in the realm of hungry ghosts, who have developed a loving attitude towards those bodhisattva great beings,🔽rise up from the realm of hungry ghosts,

original: rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
analyzed: rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
translated: and by that very wholesome root, are reborn in the world of the gods and the world of humans.

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
translated: And until they have finally passed into the realm of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left behind, they are never separated from the lord buddhas.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: Subhūti, I see with my buddha-eye

original: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul ba rnams kyi yi dgas kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad rab
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul ba rnams kyi yi dgas kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad rab
translated: In the western direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, in the realms of hungry ghosts, completely pacify all the sufferings of the hungry ghosts in those realms,

original: tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /
translated: and they teach the Dharma in order to abandon miserliness. The hungry ghosts in those realms generate a loving mind toward those bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par @3b ldang ba dang // de dag yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
analyzed: yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par @3b ldang ba dang // de dag yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
translated: and they rise up from those rebirths as hungry ghosts. Having risen up from those rebirths as hungry ghosts, through that very root of virtue they are reborn in the world of the gods and in the world of humans.

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du /
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du /
translated: and until they have attained complete nirvāṇa in the dhātu of no remainder of the aggregates,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //

analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na / byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa rnams kyi yi dgas kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad rab
translated: “Subhūti, with my buddha eye I see🔽in the world systems in the northern direction, numerous as the sands of the river Ganges, bodhisattva great beings who, in the realms of the hungry ghosts,🔽pacify all the sufferings of the hungry ghosts in those realms and teach the Dharma in order to eliminate stinginess.🔽The hungry ghosts in those realms develop a loving mind toward those bodhisattva great beings

original: tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /

translated: and until they have attained final nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left behind, they are never separated from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: Subhūti, when I look down on the world with my Buddha-eye,

original: 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa rnams kyi yi dgas kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad
analyzed: 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa rnams kyi yi dgas kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad
translated: I see bodhisattva great beings in the world systems in the downward direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, who have gone to the realms of hungry ghosts.

original: rab tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: rab tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /
translated: And they see those beings in the realm of hungry ghosts who, because of the bodhisattva great beings’ love,

original: yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
analyzed: yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
translated: are freed from the realm of hungry ghosts and, because of those wholesome roots, are reborn in the world of gods and the world of humans,

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
translated: and until they have attained the realm of nirvana without any aggregates left behind, they are never separated from the lord buddhas.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, I see with my buddha-eye

original: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams @6a *//
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams @6a *//
translated: the world systems that are above,

original: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa rnams kyi yi dgas kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad rab tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa rnams kyi yi dgas kyi yul de dag na sdug bsngal ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad rab tu 'jil zhing ser sna spang ba'i
translated: “On the banks of the Ganges, bodhisattva great beings are eliminating all the sufferings of the beings who are in the realm of the pretas.

original: phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: phyir chos ston pa dang / de dag na sems can yi dgas kyi yul pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems bskyed cing /
translated: They are teaching the Dharma so that the pretas will give up their stinginess, and the pretas who are in that realm are developing loving kindness toward those bodhisattva great beings.

original: yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
analyzed: yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag yi dgas kyi skye gnas de dag nas rnam par langs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis lha'i 'jig rten dang / mi'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
translated: They are rising up from the preta realm, and having risen up from the preta realm, through those roots of virtue they are born in the world of the gods and the world of humans.

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
translated: and they will never be separated from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, until they have attained the final Nirvana in the realm of Nirvana which leaves nothing behind.

original: rab 'byor / ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: Subhuti: I too, O Lord, with the vision of the Buddha see

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams la chos ston pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams la chos ston pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang /
translated: in the eastern direction, in world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges, Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas teaching the Dharma to the Catur­maharajakayikas, to the Trayastrimsas, to the Yamas, to the Tusitas, to the Nirmāṇaratis, to the Paranirmitavasavartins,

original: 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la chos ston pa dang / @6b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag las lha'i bu de dag gis chos de thos nas theg pa gsum pos rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la chos ston pa dang / @6b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag las lha'i bu de dag gis chos de thos nas theg pa gsum pos rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa dang /
translated: and the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations and the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, and the bodhisattva great beings, and the gods hear that Dharma, and gradually attain final nirvāṇa through the three vehicles,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba mthong ste /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba mthong ste /

translated: in the northeast, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,🔽he sees the bodhisattva great beings teaching the Dharma to the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, to the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa realm, to the gods of the Yāma realm, to the gods of the Tuṣita realm, to the gods of the Nirmāṇa­rata realm, and to the gods of the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag las lha'i bu de dag gis chos de thos nas theg pa gsum pos rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag las lha'i bu de dag gis chos de thos nas theg pa gsum pos rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba mthong ste /
translated: He sees the gods of those realms who, having heard the Dharma from those bodhisattva great beings, gradually attain complete nirvāṇa through the three vehicles, and who are attaining complete nirvāṇa and will attain complete nirvāṇa.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems can rnams la zang zing gi sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa'i bde ba dang ldan par 'god de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems can rnams la zang zing gi sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa'i bde ba dang ldan par 'god de /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom give material gifts to sentient beings, they use skillful means to establish them in unsurpassed happiness.

original: rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: Subhūti, that is

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar dang rmad du byung ba'i chos so //🔽rab 'byor / ji ltar na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar dang rmad du byung ba'i chos so // rab 'byor / ji ltar na /
translated: the amazing and marvelous Dharma of bodhisattva great beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos kyi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos kyi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom gather sentient beings through the gift of Dharma?

original: rab 'byor / gnyis po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gnyis po 'di dag ni /
translated: Subhūti, there are two kinds of

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
translated: the gift of Dharma:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: rab 'byor / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the gift of mundane dharmas?

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams brjod pa dang / bshad pa dang / ma nor bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams brjod pa dang / bshad pa dang / ma nor bar bstan pa ste /
translated: It is the teaching, the explanation, and the unerring demonstration of mundane dharmas.

original: 'di ltar mi gtsang ba'i rnam pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshangs pa'i rnam par spyod pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i chos byis pa so so'i skye bo dag dang thun mong du gyur pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi gtsang ba'i rnam pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshangs pa'i rnam par spyod pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i chos byis pa so so'i skye bo dag dang thun mong du gyur pa rnams te /
translated: They are the aspects of impurity, the four concentrations, the four practices of Brahmā, the four formless absorptions, the five kinds of supernormal knowledge, and other mundane dharmas that are shared in common with ordinary beings.

original: rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: Subhūti,

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: that is the gift of mundane dharmas.

original: rab @18a *// 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des 'jig rten gyi chos kyi sbyin pa de btang nas rnam grangs du mas 'jig rten gyi chos ma nor bar blangs pa de las bskyod de /
analyzed: rab @18a *// 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des 'jig rten gyi chos kyi sbyin pa de btang nas rnam grangs du mas 'jig rten gyi chos ma nor bar blangs pa de las bskyod de /
translated: “Subhūti, having given that gift of mundane dharmas, the bodhisattva great being, by many ways, causes those mundane dharmas to be unerringly received and then causes them to be transcended.

original: de las bskyod nas thabs mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu dag la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: de las bskyod nas thabs mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu dag la rab tu 'god do //
translated: Having moved them from that, he establishes them in the noble dharmas and the fruits of the noble dharmas by skillful means.

original: de la 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni /🔽gang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni / gang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni /
translated: What are the noble dharmas?

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fruits of the noble dharmas?

original: 'phags pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The noble dharmas are

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang; dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang; dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of magical power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the eightfold noble path,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams so /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams so /
translated: and the three gateways to liberation: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni /
translated: The fruits of the noble dharmas are

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid de /
translated: and arhatship.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos ni /
translated: Subhūti, the noble dharmas of bodhisattva great beings

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
translated: are the knowledge of the fruit of entering the stream,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of arhatship.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
translated: They are the knowledge of the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @18b phyin pa shes pa'o //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @18b phyin pa shes pa'o // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the perfection of conduct,🔽the knowledge of the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: They are the knowledge of inner emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid shes pa'o //🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid shes pa'o // phyi nang stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know outer emptiness.🔽It is to know inner and outer emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know the emptiness of emptiness.

original: chen po stong pa nyid shes pa'o //🔽don dam pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid shes pa'o // don dam pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know great emptiness.🔽It is to know ultimate emptiness.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid shes pa'o //🔽'dus ma byas stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid shes pa'o // 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know conditioned emptiness.🔽It is to know unconditioned emptiness.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o // thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.🔽It is to know the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know the emptiness of nonrejection.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽It is to know the emptiness of defining characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid shes pa'o; ;mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid shes pa'o; ;mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know the emptiness of nonobservation.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o //🔽ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid shes pa'o // ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know the emptiness of nonexistence.🔽It is to know the emptiness of essence.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is to know the emptiness of the essence of nonexistence.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the four right efforts.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi shes pa'o //🔽dbang po lnga shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi shes pa'o // dbang po lnga shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the four legs of miraculous power.🔽It is the knowledge of the five faculties.

original: stobs lnga shes pa'o //
analyzed: stobs lnga shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the five powers.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the seven parts of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the four truths of the noble ones.

original: bsam gtan bzhi shes pa'o //🔽tshad med pa bzhi @19a *//
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi shes pa'o // tshad med pa bzhi @19a *//
translated: It is the knowledge of the four concentrations.🔽It is the knowledge of the four immeasurables.

original: shes pa'o // gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'o // gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the four formless absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the eight liberations.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu shes pa'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the nine serial absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are the gate to liberation.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the clairvoyances.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams shes pa'o; ;gzungs kyi sgo rnams shes pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams shes pa'o; ;gzungs kyi sgo rnams shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the meditative stabilities. It is the knowledge of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes pa'o //🔽mi 'jigs pa bzhi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes pa'o // mi 'jigs pa bzhi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the ten powers of the Tathagata.🔽It is the knowledge of the four grounds of self-confidence.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi shes pa'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the four analytical knowledges.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad shes pa'o //🔽byams pa chen po shes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad shes pa'o // byams pa chen po shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas.🔽It is the knowledge of great love.

original: snying rje chen po shes pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of great compassion.

original: dga' ba chen po shes pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of great joy.

original: btang snyoms chen po shes pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms chen po shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of great equanimity.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams shes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the knowledge of mundane and supramundane dharmas, of dharmas with outflows and without outflows, of conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ma gtogs par /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ma gtogs par /
translated: Except for the knowledge of a knower of all aspects,

original: de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: those are the noble dharmas of a bodhisattva great being.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fruit of the noble dharmas of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva?

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba ste /
translated: It is the abandonment of all afflictions along with their traces and latencies.

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' @19b sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' @19b sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the fruit of the noble dharmas of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram /
translated: Will the bodhisattva-mahāsattva attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
analyzed: de de bzhin te; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
translated: It is so! The bodhisattva-mahāsattva

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: will attain the knowledge of all aspects.🔽” Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur na /
translated: “If a bodhisattva great being were to attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bye brag ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bye brag ci zhig mchis /
translated: what would be the difference between a bodhisattva great being and a tathāgata?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: bye brag yod do //
analyzed: bye brag yod do //
translated: “There is a difference.”

original: gsol pa / bye brag ji lta bu zhig mchis /
analyzed: gsol pa / bye brag ji lta bu zhig mchis /
translated: He asked, “What is the difference?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said, “A bodhisattva great being

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: attains the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: but a tathāgata

original: ye shes brnyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes brnyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is said to have attained gnosis.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gang la gnas shing chos thams cad mun pa med pa thob pa la byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: gang la gnas shing chos thams cad mun pa med pa thob pa la byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyang gzhan la /
translated: While abiding in that, he attains the absence of darkness with regard to all dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyang gzhan zhes bya ba med @20a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyang gzhan zhes bya ba med @20a *//
translated: The mind of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha is not something other than those dharmas.

original: do; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: do; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
translated: that is the bodhisattva great beings’ mundane Dharma giving,

original: de la brten pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la brten pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa 'byung ngo //
translated: on the basis of which the supramundane Dharma giving arises.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa la sbyor zhing thabs mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa la bkod nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la 'god pa yin no
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa la sbyor zhing thabs mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa la bkod nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la 'god pa yin no
translated: in that way bodhisattva great beings connect beings to the mundane Dharma giving and, through skillful means, having established them in the noble supramundane Dharma giving, establish them in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: // rab 'byor /
analyzed: // rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s supramundane Dharma generosity that is not shared in common with all foolish ordinary beings?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: It is as follows:🔽the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path,

original: tshad med bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mtha' dag gi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: tshad med bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mtha' dag gi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the four immeasurables, the three doors of liberation, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the ten universal bases, the eight bases of subjugation, the concentration of the absence of conflict,

original: smon gnas mkhyen pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: smon gnas mkhyen pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the knowledge of the object of aspiration, the six clairvoyances, the four complete purities in all aspects, the ten powers, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge,

original: bsrung du @20b med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: bsrung du @20b med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: the three things that need not be guarded, the three establishments of mindfulness, the nature of being without forgetfulness, the complete destruction of the traces, great loving kindness, great compassion, the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams te /
translated: the knowledge of all aspects, the thirty-two major marks of a great person, the eighty minor marks, the five hundred dhāraṇī gateways, and the samādhi gateways.

original: 'di ni / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the gift of the supramundane Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the four establishments of mindfulness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: nang gi lus dang / phyi'i lus dang / phyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can /
analyzed: nang gi lus dang / phyi'i lus dang / phyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can /
translated: With regard to the inner body, the outer body, and the inner and outer body, one should observe the body and be diligent,

original: shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
translated: with alertness,

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
translated: with mindfulness, and with a mind free from worldly desires and unhappiness.

original: lus la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //🔽lus la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //🔽lus la kun 'byung ba dang zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: lus la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do // lus la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do // lus la kun 'byung ba dang zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: One should observe the origin of the body.🔽One should observe the cessation of the body.🔽One should observe the origin and cessation of the body.

original: lus la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing /
analyzed: lus la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing /
translated: One should observe the body without abiding in it.

original: 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
translated: One should not grasp at anything in the world.

original: nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can /
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can /
translated: He is diligent,

original: shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
translated: has knowledge,

original: dran pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas /
translated: and is mindful.

original: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He is free from worldly attachment and depression, and he practices.

original: tshor ba la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //🔽tshor ba la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do // tshor ba la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He practices by observing the origin of feelings.🔽He practices by observing the cessation of feelings.

original: tshor ba la kun 'byung ba dang zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba la kun 'byung ba dang zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He practices by observing the origin and cessation of feelings.

original: tshor ba la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing /🔽'jig rten du @21a *//
analyzed: tshor ba la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing / 'jig rten du @21a *//
translated: He practices without dwelling on feelings.

original: gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
analyzed: gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
translated: He does not take anything in the world as his own.🔽inner mind,🔽outer mind, and both inner and outer mind.

original: nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi nang gi sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can /
analyzed: nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi nang gi sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can /
translated: He is diligent,

original: shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
translated: has knowledge,🔽and is mindful.

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
translated: Endowed with mindfulness, he or she practices while dispelling attraction and aversion toward the world.

original: sems la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //🔽sems la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: sems la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do // sems la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He or she practices while observing the arising of mind.🔽He or she practices while observing the cessation of mind.

original: sems la kun 'byung ba dang zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: sems la kun 'byung ba dang zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He or she practices while observing the arising and cessation of mind.

original: sems la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing /
analyzed: sems la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing /
translated: He or she practices without abiding in mind.

original: 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
translated: He or she does not grasp at anything in the world.

original: nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / phyi nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can /
analyzed: nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / phyi nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can /
translated: He or she practices diligence while observing phenomena, both internal and external, and phenomena that are both internal and external.

original: shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
translated: He or she is endowed with alertness.

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal cing rnam par spyod do //
translated: Endowed with mindfulness, he or she practices while dispelling attraction and aversion toward the world.

original: chos la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: chos la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He or she practices while observing the arising of phenomena.

original: chos la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //🔽chos la kun 'byung ba dang zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: chos la zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do // chos la kun 'byung ba dang zad pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He practices by observing the exhaustion of phenomena.🔽He practices by observing the origination and exhaustion of phenomena.

original: chos la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing /
analyzed: chos la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing /
translated: He practices without abiding in phenomena.

original: 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
translated: He does not take up anything in the world.

original: rab 'byor / yang dag par spong ba bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang dag par spong ba bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the four right efforts?

original: sdig to ma dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir mos pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang @21b ba'i phyir rtsol ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir mos pa bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang /
analyzed: sdig to ma dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir mos pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang @21b ba'i phyir rtsol ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir mos pa bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang /
translated: They are the generation of aspiration in order to prevent the arising of non-virtuous, negative actions that have not yet arisen, the exertion in order to abandon those that have arisen, the generation of aspiration and the exertion of effort in order to give rise to virtuous actions that have not yet arisen,

original: skyes pa rnams 'phel zhing shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mos pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams 'phel zhing shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mos pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: and the generation of aspiration in order to increase and fully cultivate those that have arisen and to perfect their cultivation.

original: rab 'byor / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the four legs of manifestation?

original: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: the basis of supernatural power that is concentration of energy accompanied by the volition of striving,

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: and the basis of supernatural power that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.

original: dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five faculties?

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste / de dag ni /
translated: They are the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the five faculties.

original: stobs lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: stobs lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five powers?

original: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs te /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs te / de dag ni /
translated: and the power of wisdom.

original: stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the five powers.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
translated: Su­bhūti, if you ask what constitute the seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽they comprise the aspect of enlightenment that is the investigation of phenomena,🔽the aspect of enlightenment that is the investigation of phenomena,🔽the aspect of enlightenment that is perseverance,

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs @22a *//
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs @22a *//
translated: the aspect of enlightenment that is joy,🔽the aspect of enlightenment that is pliancy,🔽the aspect of enlightenment that is concentration,

original: pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste / de dag ni /
translated: and the aspect of enlightenment that is equanimity.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
translated: Su­bhūti, if you ask what constitute the eight aspects of the path of the noble ones,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: and right concentration.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: These are called

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the noble eightfold path.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three concentrations?

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: They are the concentration on emptiness, the concentration on wishlessness, and the concentration on signlessness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration on emptiness?

original: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind that has the aspect of emptiness and the aspect of seclusion.🔽This is called

original: de ni / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: the concentration on emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration on wishlessness?

original: zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: the aspect of peace, and the aspect of signlessness.

original: de ni / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the concentration on signlessness.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration on wishlessness?

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind with the aspects of impermanence and suffering.

original: de ni / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the concentration on wishlessness.

original: rnam par @22b thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /🔽gzugs can gyis gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par @22b thar pa brgyad gang zhe na / gzugs can gyis gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni /
translated: What are the eight liberations?

original: rnam par thar pa dang po'o //🔽nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang po'o // nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni /
translated: The first liberation is for one who has a form to see forms.

original: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //🔽bzang bar mos pa 'di ni /🔽rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o // bzang bar mos pa 'di ni / rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: The second liberation is for one who has no internal form to see forms.🔽The third liberation is for one who has no internal form to see forms.

original: rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth liberation is for one who has no internal form to see forms.🔽The fifth liberation is for one who has no internal form to see forms.🔽The sixth liberation is for one who has no internal form to see forms.🔽The seventh liberation is for one who has no internal form to see forms.🔽The eighth liberation is for one who has no internal form to see forms.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: They are the bases of mastery over:🔽the sphere of infinite consciousness,🔽

original: rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //🔽cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o // cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: “The fifth liberation is the attainment of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //🔽'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa drug pa'o // 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: The sixth liberation is the attainment of the base of nothingness.

original: rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //🔽'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o // 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: The seventh liberation is the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste / de dag ni /
translated: The eighth liberation is the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the eight liberations.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the nine serial steps of meditative absorption?

original: 'di la la la 'dod pas dben /
analyzed: 'di la la la 'dod pas dben /
translated: Here, someone, secluded from sensual pleasures,

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: secluded from nonvirtuous qualities,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with applied and sustained thought,🔽with joy and bliss born of seclusion,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /🔽sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas @23a *//🔽rtog pa med pa /🔽dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste / sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas @23a *// rtog pa med pa / dpyod pa med pa /
translated: He dwells having attained the first concentration, which is accompanied by investigation and sustained thought, and is filled with joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: With the calming of investigation and sustained thought, he dwells having attained the second concentration, which is filled with the joy and bliss born of meditative stabilization.

original: shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas te bde ba lus kyis myong la /🔽'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa /🔽bde ba la rnam par spyod pa /
analyzed: shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas te bde ba lus kyis myong la / 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa / bde ba la rnam par spyod pa /
translated: With the fading away of joy, he dwells having attained the third concentration, which is filled with bliss and is endowed with equanimity and mindfulness.🔽He dwells having attained the fourth concentration, which is neither blissful nor suffering, and is filled with pure equanimity and mindfulness.🔽“He dwells having attained the first concentration, which is accompanied by investigation and sustained thought, and is filled with joy and bliss born of seclusion.”

original: btang snyoms pa'o //🔽zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms pa'o // zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: “With the calming of investigation and sustained thought, he dwells having attained the second concentration, which is filled with the joy and bliss born of meditative stabilization.”

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: “With the fading away of joy, he dwells having attained the third concentration, which is filled with bliss and is endowed with equanimity and mindfulness.”🔽“He dwells having attained the fourth concentration, which is neither blissful nor suffering, and is filled with pure equanimity and mindfulness.”

original: de bde ba'ang spangs; sdug bsngal yang spangs shing /🔽yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba'ang med /
analyzed: de bde ba'ang spangs; sdug bsngal yang spangs shing / yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba'ang med /
translated: He has abandoned pleasure, and also abandoned pain,

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang med pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang med pa /
translated: and previously abandoned mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction, so he is neither happy nor unhappy.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pas yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pas yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having attained the fourth absorption, which is complete purity of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: He completely transcends perceptions of form, and the perceptions of obstruction disappear.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
translated: He does not pay attention to the perception of variety, thinking, ‘Space is infinite,’

original: zhes te / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: zhes te / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and he dwells having attained the sphere of infinite space.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so //
translated: He completely transcends the sphere of infinite space, thinking, ‘Consciousness is infinite,’

original: zhes te / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar @23b bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: zhes te / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar @23b bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and he dwells having attained the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te cung zad ma yod do //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te cung zad ma yod do //
translated: He completely transcends the sphere of infinite consciousness and thinks, ‘There is nothing at all.’

original: zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shas med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shas med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He achieves and remains in the sphere of nothing-at-all.🔽He completely transcends the sphere of nothing-at-all and achieves and remains in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te /
translated: He completely transcends the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception and achieves and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: 'di ni / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the nine serial absorptions.

original: de la mtha' dag gi skye mched bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtha' dag gi skye mched bcu gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the ten universal spheres?

original: mtha' dag sa dang / mtha' dag chu dang / mtha' dag me dang / mtha' dag rlung dang / mtha' dag sngon po dang / mtha' dag ser po dang / mtha' dag dmar po dang / mtha' dag dkar po dang / mtha' dag rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: mtha' dag sa dang / mtha' dag chu dang / mtha' dag me dang / mtha' dag rlung dang / mtha' dag sngon po dang / mtha' dag ser po dang / mtha' dag dmar po dang / mtha' dag dkar po dang / mtha' dag rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: the totality of earth, the totality of water, the totality of fire, the totality of wind, the totality of blue, the totality of yellow, the totality of red, the totality of white, the totality of consciousness,

original: mtha' dag nam mkha' ste /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: mtha' dag nam mkha' ste / de dag ni /
translated: and the totality of space.🔽These are called

original: mtha' dag gi skye mched bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag gi skye mched bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: the ten totalities.

original: de la zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the eight spheres of mastery?

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs phra mo dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs phra mo dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
translated: Perceiving forms internally, one sees external forms that are small, beautiful, and ugly. One knows those forms to be mastered,

original: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing /🔽de ltar 'du shes pa de ni /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing / de ltar 'du shes pa de ni /
translated: sees them to be mastered,🔽and has the perception of them in that way.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang @24a *//
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang @24a *//
translated: This is the first sphere of mastery.

original: po'o; ;nang gzugs su 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rags pa dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
analyzed: po'o; ;nang gzugs su 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rags pa dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
translated: “ Perceiving forms internally, one sees external forms that are coarse, beautiful, and ugly.

original: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing /
translated: One sees those forms having subdued them.

original: de ltar 'du shes pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes pa de ni /
translated: One perceives them in this way.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //🔽nang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs phra mo dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o // nang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs phra mo dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
translated: This is the second sphere of mastery.🔽“ Perceiving no forms internally, one sees external forms that are subtle, beautiful, and ugly.

original: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing /
translated: One sees those forms having subdued them.

original: de ltar 'du shes pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes pa /
translated: One perceives them in this way.

original: de ni / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third sphere of mastery.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rags pa dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rags pa dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
translated: “ Perceiving no forms internally, one sees external forms that are coarse, beautiful, and ugly.

original: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing /
translated: and he sees them as though he were overpowering them.

original: de ltar 'du shes pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes pa de ni /
translated: This is how he perceives them.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth station of mastery.

analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po /

analyzed: mdog dkar bar mthong yang @25a *// gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
translated: white in hue.🔽They see those forms,🔽overpowering them,

analyzed: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing / de ltar 'du shes pa 'di ni /
