original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth sphere of mastery.

original: de la nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the absence of conflict?

original: bsam gtan la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam par spyod pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam par spyod pa /
translated: It is the concentration through which bodhisattva great beings, abiding in the dhyānas,

original: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi nyon mongs pa me skye ba'i mthu yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang gis 'grub pa de ni /
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi nyon mongs pa me skye ba'i mthu yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang gis 'grub pa de ni /
translated: are able to prevent the arising of the afflictions of other sentient beings and other individuals.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the absence of afflictions.

original: smon lam gyi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: smon lam gyi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the knowledge of aspiration?

original: bsam gtan la gnas te 'di shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la gnas te 'di shes par bya'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of remaining in concentration, thinking, ‘I will know this.’

original: zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dus gsum gyi shes pa'am /
analyzed: zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dus gsum gyi shes pa'am /
translated: When a bodhisattva mahāsattva has the knowledge of the three times,

original: shes pa gang dang gang 'dod par gyur pa de la yid kyis smon pa byed de /
analyzed: shes pa gang dang gang 'dod par gyur pa de la yid kyis smon pa byed de /
translated: or whatever knowledge he wishes for, he makes a mental aspiration.

original: de ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas de'i smon lam de yongs su grub par gyur cing /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas de'i smon lam de yongs su grub par gyur cing /
translated: When he rises from that concentration, his aspiration is fulfilled,

original: shes bya de'ang shes pa de ni /
analyzed: shes bya de'ang shes pa de ni /
translated: and he knows that object of knowledge.

original: smon lam gyi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the knowledge of aspiration.

original: de la mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the six higher knowledges?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: They are the higher knowledge of miraculous powers, the higher knowledge of the divine eye, the higher knowledge of the divine ear, the higher knowledge of knowing the minds of others, the higher knowledge of recollecting former states, and the higher knowledge of knowing the cessation of defilements.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ste /
translated: the supernormal knowledge of the knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants.

original: drug po de dag go /
analyzed: drug po de dag go /
translated: These are the six.

original: de la yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the four purities?

original: @25b lus yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: @25b lus yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Purity of body, purity of object, purity of mind, and purity of knowledge.

original: bzhi po de dag go /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag go /
translated: These are the four.

original: de la dbang bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbang bcu gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the ten masteries?

original: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang; ye shes la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang; ye shes la dbang ba dang /
translated: Mastery over life, mastery over mind, mastery over requisites, mastery over action, mastery over birth, mastery over aspiration, mastery over miraculous powers, mastery over wisdom,

original: chos la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: chos la dbang ba ste /
translated: mastery over the Dharma,🔽and mastery over the support.

original: bcu po de dag go /
analyzed: bcu po de dag go /
translated: These are the ten.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
translated: “Su­bhūti, what are the ten powers of the tathāgatas?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas la'ang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas la'ang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Subhuti: Here the Tathagata knows the possible as possible and the impossible as impossible.

original: gnas ma yin pa la'ang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la'ang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is:

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las dang / las yongs su blangs pa'i rnam par smin pa gnas kyi rnam pa dang / rgyu'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las dang / las yongs su blangs pa'i rnam par smin pa gnas kyi rnam pa dang / rgyu'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the result of the action of beings in the past, future, and present, in accordance with the causal basis and the cause;

original: khams sna tshogs can dang / khams du ma can gyi 'jig rten yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs can dang / khams du ma can gyi 'jig rten yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the world with its various elements and its manifold elements;

original: sems can gzhan dang / gang zag gzhan gyis mos pa sna tshogs dang / mos pa du ma yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dang / gang zag gzhan gyis mos pa sna tshogs dang / mos pa du ma yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the various and manifold inclinations of other beings and persons;

original: sems can gzhan dang / gang zag gzhan gyi dbang po rab dang / tha ma shes par bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dang / gang zag gzhan gyi dbang po rab dang / tha ma shes par bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the faculties of other beings and other persons, whether they are superior or not, just as they are.

original: @26a *// kun tu 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: @26a *// kun tu 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the path that leads everywhere, just as it is.

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the arrangement of the faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions, just as they are.

original: rnam pa du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dgongs te /
analyzed: rnam pa du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dgongs te /
translated: He recollects his many previous abodes, with their aspects and particulars.

original: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dgongs pa nas tshe rabs brgya dang / tshe rabs stong dang / tshe rabs brgya stong dang / tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar du'ang rjes su dgongs so //
analyzed: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dgongs pa nas tshe rabs brgya dang / tshe rabs stong dang / tshe rabs brgya stong dang / tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi bar du'ang rjes su dgongs so //
translated: He recollects one eon, and then two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, one hundred, one thousand, one hundred thousand, and even up to many quintillions of eons.🔽He recollects: ‘I was born in such and such a place, my name was such and such, my caste was such and such, my family was such and such, my food was such and such, I experienced such and such pleasures and pains, and I lived for such and such a length of time.’🔽He recollects: ‘After I died there, I was born in such and such a place.’🔽In this way he recollects his various previous lives with their characteristics and circumstances.🔽He recollects one life, and then two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, one hundred, one thousand, one hundred thousand, and even up to many quintillions of lives.

original: bskal pa gcig kyang rjes su dgongs pa nas bskal pa brgya'i bar dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang rjes su dgongs te /🔽bdag ni / 'di lta bu zhig na 'dug 'dug go /🔽ming ni / 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig kyang rjes su dgongs pa nas bskal pa brgya'i bar dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang rjes su dgongs te / bdag ni / 'di lta bu zhig na 'dug 'dug go / ming ni / 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: He recollects one eon, and then two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, one hundred, one thousand, one hundred thousand, and even up to many quintillions of eons.

original: rigs ni / 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: rigs ni / 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: He recollects: ‘I was born in such and such a place, my name was such and such, my caste was such and such, my family was such and such, my food was such and such, I experienced such and such pleasures and pains, and I lived for such and such a length of time.’

original: rus ni / 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //🔽zas ni / 'di za za'o //🔽yun ni / 'di srid cig tu gnas gnas so //
analyzed: rus ni / 'di zhes bya bar gyur to // zas ni / 'di za za'o // yun ni / 'di srid cig tu gnas gnas so //
translated: He recollects: ‘After I died there, I was born in such and such a place.’

original: tshe'i mtha' ni /
analyzed: tshe'i mtha' ni /
translated: In this way he recollects his various previous lives with their characteristics and circumstances.

original: 'di tsam zhig tu gyur te /🔽bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig tu gyur te / bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
translated: “This is how far it has extended.🔽After I died there, I was reborn in such and such a place.

original: zhes bya ba nas de nas shi 'phos nas kyang @26b 'dir skyes so //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa dang bcas /🔽sa mal dang bcas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas de nas shi 'phos nas kyang @26b 'dir skyes so // zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa dang bcas / sa mal dang bcas /
translated: After I died there, I was reborn here.”

original: gtan tshigs dang bcas par rnam pa du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dgongs so //🔽lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag kyang gzigs so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang bcas par rnam pa du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dgongs so // lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag kyang gzigs so //
translated: In this way, with its aspects and particulars, and with its causes, he recollects his many past abodes.🔽With his purified divine eye, he sees beings passing away and being born, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and he understands how beings go to good destinations or bad destinations according to their deeds.🔽“These beings who engaged in misconduct by body,

original: kha dog sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / bzang ba dang / ngan pa dang / bde 'gro na 'khod pa dang / ngan song na 'khod pa dang / las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'dong ba'i sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: kha dog sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / bzang ba dang / ngan pa dang / bde 'gro na 'khod pa dang / ngan song na 'khod pa dang / las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'dong ba'i sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: speech, and mind, who abused and insulted the noble ones, who held wrong views and had wrong views actions,🔽after the breakup of their bodies, died and were reborn in a bad place, a bad destination, a lower realm, or hell.

original: sems can 'di dag ni /🔽lus kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni / lus kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: “These beings who engaged in good conduct by body,

original: ngag gis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: speech, and mind, who did not abuse or insult the noble ones, who held right views and had right views actions,🔽after the breakup of their bodies, died and were reborn in good places, good destinations, or the heavens.”

original: yid kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyis ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: have engaged in negative actions with their mind,

original: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa /
translated: have denigrated the noble ones,

original: log par lta ba dag ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba dag ste /
translated: and have had distorted views.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas ngan song log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas ngan song log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye'o //
translated: Due to that cause and that condition, when their body breaks up, they fall into the lower realms and are born in the hells.

original: sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: These sentient beings

original: lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: have engaged in positive actions with their body,

original: ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: have engaged in positive actions with their speech,

original: yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: have engaged in positive actions with their mind,🔽have not denigrated the noble ones,

original: 'phags pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa yang dag par lta ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa yang dag par lta ba dag ste /
translated: and have had correct views.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha'i nang du skye'o //🔽zhes bya bar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha'i nang du skye'o // zhes bya bar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Due to that cause and that condition, when their body breaks up, they go to the happy realms and are born among the gods in the higher worlds.

original: zag pa rnams zad pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / zag pa med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / zag pa med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows as it truly is: ‘Due to the exhaustion of the contaminants, the mind is liberated and the wisdom is liberated.

original: bcu po de @27a *//
analyzed: bcu po de @27a *//
translated: These are the ten powers of the Tathāgata.

original: dag ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: dag ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs so //

analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhuti, what are the four confidences of the Tathagata?

original: bdag gis yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bdag gis yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: zhes dam bcas na /

analyzed: de la chos 'di rnams mngon par sangs ma rgyas so //

original: zhes bya bar bdag la dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: zhes bya bar bdag la dge sbyong ngam /

analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /

analyzed: skye dgu'i tshogs gzhan su'ang rung ste / 'jig rten na chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bdag bde ba thob pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob par rnam par spyod de /

analyzed: khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //
translated: and I declare the state of the unexcelled great bull.

analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra sgrog go /

analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo 'jig rten na dge sbyong ngam /

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /

analyzed: bdag zag pa zad do // zhes dam bcas na / de la zag pa 'di rnams yongs su zad par ma gyur to //

analyzed: zhes bya bar bdag la dge sbyong ngam / bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: If anyone were to argue with me about this, saying, ‘These defilements have not been ended,’🔽I would not see any reason for that, whether it be an ascetic,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /

analyzed: skye rgu'i tshogs gzhan su'ang rung ste / 'jig rten na chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur @27b ro; ;zhes bya ba'i rgyu'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste / rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
translated: or anyone else in the world.

analyzed: de la bdag bde ba thob pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob pa rnams par spyod de /
translated: Since I do not see any reason for that, I have attained happiness, attained fearlessness, and attained self-confidence.

analyzed: khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //

analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo 'jig rten na dge sbyong ngam /

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: brāhmaṇa, god,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /

analyzed: gzhan sus kyang rung ste / chos dang ldan par bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o //

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: brāhmaṇa, god,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /

original: 'jig rten na chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba'i rgyu'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba'i rgyu'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /

analyzed: rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /

original: de la bdag bde ba thob pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob par rnam par spyod de /🔽khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //
analyzed: de la bdag bde ba thob pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob par rnam par spyod de / khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //

original: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra sgrog go /🔽tshangs pa'i 'khor lo 'jig rten na dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze'am / lha'am /🔽bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /

translated: He proclaims his lion’s roar in the midst of the assembly.

original: gzhan sus kyang rung ste /🔽chos dang ldan par bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o //🔽gang @28a *// yang bdag gis lam 'phags pa'i 'byung ba rtogs par 'gyur ba de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur bar bstan pa de dag la nan tan byas na /🔽sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan sus kyang rung ste / chos dang ldan par bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o // gang @28a *// yang bdag gis lam 'phags pa'i 'byung ba rtogs par 'gyur ba de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur bar bstan pa de dag la nan tan byas na / sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: He sets in motion the wheel of Brahmā that cannot be undone by any mendicant, brahmin, god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world.🔽He says, ‘I will teach the path that leads to the realization of the noble ones’ Dharma, and if anyone, whether a mendicant, a brahmin, a god, a Māra, a Brahmā, or anyone else in the world, should say that by practicing this path one will not fully experience the cessation of suffering, then that would go against what I know to be true.

original: zhes dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze'am / lha'am /🔽bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: zhes dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze'am / lha'am /🔽bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
translated: If I were to teach the path that leads to the realization of the noble ones’ Dharma, and if anyone, whether a mendicant, a brahmin, a god, a Māra, a Brahmā, or anyone else in the world, should say that by practicing this path one will not fully experience the cessation of suffering, that would not go against what I know to be true.

original: skyed gu'i tshogs gzhan su'ang rung ste /
analyzed: skyed gu'i tshogs gzhan su'ang rung ste /
translated: “I do not see any other assembly in the world that could legitimately oppose me.

original: 'jig rten na chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be a virtuous opponent in the world.🔽

original: zhes bya ba'i rgyu'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rgyu'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: “I do not see any legitimate reason for that.

original: rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
analyzed: rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
translated: Since I do not see any reason,

original: de la bdag bde ba thob pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob par rnam par spyod de /🔽khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //
analyzed: de la bdag bde ba thob pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob par rnam par spyod de / khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //
translated: I have attained happiness, attained fearlessness, and attained independence.

original: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra bsgrag go //🔽tshangs pa'i 'khor lo 'jig rten na dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra bsgrag go // tshangs pa'i 'khor lo 'jig rten na dge sbyong ngam /
translated: I will roar the lion’s roar in the assembly.

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: I will turn the wheel that has not been turned anywhere in the world by any renunciant, brahmin, god,🔽demon,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
translated: Brahmā,

original: gzhan su'ang rung ste /🔽chos dang ldan par bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan su'ang rung ste / chos dang ldan par bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: or anyone else.🔽”

original: bzhi po de dag ni /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni /
translated: These are the four forms of

original: mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: fearlessness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of correct knowledge of the Tathāgata?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: correct knowledge of meaning, correct knowledge of phenomena, correct knowledge of definitions, and correct knowledge of eloquence.

original: de dag kyang @28b gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang @28b gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: don la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig la dmigs pa dang / spobs pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: don la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig la dmigs pa dang / spobs pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: They are the focus on meaning, the focus on phenomena, the focus on definitions, and the focus on eloquence.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsrung ba med pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsrung ba med pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what are the three kinds of fearlessness of the Tathāgata?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: has a pure physical conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas /🔽la las shes su 'ong /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas / la las shes su 'ong /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any impure physical conduct.

original: zhes gang yang bcabs par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: zhes gang yang bcabs par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: He does not think, “Let some people know this,🔽but not others.”

original: 'di ni / bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni /🔽gsung gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / bsrung ba med pa dang po'o // de bzhin gshegs pa ni / gsung gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: This is the first fearlessness.🔽The Tathāgata is endowed with completely pure conduct of speech.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gsung gi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa me mnga' bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gsung gi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa me mnga' bas /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have impure conduct of speech.

original: la las shes su 'ong zhes gang yang bcabs par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: la las shes su 'ong zhes gang yang bcabs par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any thoughts of concealment, thinking, ‘If others find out, it will not look good.’

original: 'di ni / bsrung ba med pa gnyis pa'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni / bsrung ba med pa gnyis pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: This is the second fearlessness.

original: thugs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is endowed with completely pure conduct of mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la thugs kyi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la thugs kyi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have impure conduct of mind.

original: la las shes su 'ong zhes gang yang bcabs par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: la las shes su 'ong zhes gang yang bcabs par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any thoughts of concealment, thinking, ‘If others find out, it will not look good.’

original: 'di ni / bsrung ba med pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / bsrung ba med pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third fearlessness.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three ways of establishing the Tathāgata’s intention?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa'i tshe la la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa'i tshe la la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan cing /
translated: When the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma, some people listen with their ears attentive and

original: bka' mnyan pa'i @29a *//
analyzed: bka' mnyan pa'i @29a *//
translated: with a mind that is ready to receive his words.

original: sems nye bar gzhog pa dang / chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur /🔽yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems nye bar gzhog pa dang / chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur / yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They are diligent in the Dharma and in the practice of the Dharma, but that does not please the Tathāgata,🔽does not delight his mind,

original: thugs yeng yeng bor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thugs yeng yeng bor mi 'gyur te /
translated: and does not cause him to be attentive.

original: 'di ni / dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first form of attention.🔽Some people do not listen with their ears attentive and with a mind that is ready to receive his words,

original: la la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan cing bka' mnyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog pa med pa dang / chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du mi byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs khro bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: la la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan cing bka' mnyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog pa med pa dang / chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du mi byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs khro bar mi 'gyur /
translated: and they are not diligent in the Dharma and in the practice of the Dharma, but that does not cause the Tathāgata to be angry,

original: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
translated: does not cause him to be intolerant,

original: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and does not cause him to be distrustful.

original: 'di ni / dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second form of attention.

original: la la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan cing bka' mnyan pa'i sems nya bar gzhog la /
analyzed: la la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan cing bka' mnyan pa'i sems nya bar gzhog la /
translated: Some listen with bowed ears, and they set their minds on obeying the teachings.

original: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byed /
analyzed: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byed /
translated: They are diligent in the Dharma and in the practice of the Dharma.

original: la la rna ba btud de rim gror mi nyan cing /
analyzed: la la rna ba btud de rim gror mi nyan cing /
translated: Some do not listen with bowed ears,

original: bka' mnyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog pa med de /🔽chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du mi byed kyang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes pa'am /
analyzed: bka' mnyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog pa med de / chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du mi byed kyang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes pa'am /
translated: and they do not set their minds on obeying the teachings.🔽They are not diligent in the Dharma and in the practice of the Dharma.

original: thugs khro ba gnyis su mi 'gyur te /🔽thams cad du dgongs pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen par btang snyoms su rnam par spyod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: thugs khro ba gnyis su mi 'gyur te / thams cad du dgongs pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen par btang snyoms su rnam par spyod pa 'di ni /
translated: But that does not cause the Tathāgata to be pleased or displeased.

original: dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa'o //
translated: He is always attentive, and he acts with the equanimity of knowledge. This is the third attention.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the Tathāgata’s nature of being without error?

original: gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams don yod @29b pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams don yod @29b pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi 'da' ba ste /
translated: It is that by which the lord buddhas, in order to teach the Dharma that is not in vain, accomplish the welfare of all beings without passing beyond the time.

original: de ni / nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the “nature of non-degeneration.”

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bag chags kyi sgrib pa rab tu spangs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bag chags kyi sgrib pa rab tu spangs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the Tathāgata’s elimination of the obscurations of the latent tendencies?”

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni /
translated: All śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: nyon mongs pa spangs kyang de dag la lus kyi 'gyur ba yod kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs kyang de dag la lus kyi 'gyur ba yod kyi /
translated: have eliminated the afflictions, but they still have physical changes.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: de lta bu'ang mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'ang mi mnga' ste /
translated: does not have such things.

original: de ni / bag chags kyi sgrib pa rab tu spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / bag chags kyi sgrib pa rab tu spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the “elimination of the obscurations of the latent tendencies.”

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the Tathāgata’s great compassion?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen po gang dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brda nye bar bzung ste /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba gzigs pa'i phyir dus thams cad du 'jig rten la nyin lan gsum /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen po gang dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brda nye bar bzung ste / dge ba'i rtsa ba gzigs pa'i phyir dus thams cad du 'jig rten la nyin lan gsum /
translated: The Tathāgata, endowed with great compassion, uses worldly conventions🔽to see the roots of virtue and at all times, three times during the day and three times during the night,

original: mtshan lan gsum du rtog pa mdzad ces bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan lan gsum du rtog pa mdzad ces bya ste /
translated: he considers the world.

original: dngos su na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba gzigs pa rtag par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dngos su na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba gzigs pa rtag par 'byung ste /
translated: In reality, the great compassion of the blessed buddhas, which sees the ripening of infinite sentient beings, always occurs.

original: de ni / thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: de ni / thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o; ;rab 'byor /
translated: That is called “great compassion.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the Tathāgata’s eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has no error.

original: ca co mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ca co mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no chatter.

original: dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no loss of mindfulness.

original: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o //🔽thugs mnyam par ma gzhag pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o // thugs mnyam par ma gzhag pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no diverse thoughts.🔽He has no lack of meditative equipoise.

original: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //

original: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //

original: @30a *// brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //🔽dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: @30a *// brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o // dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no loss of meditative concentration.

original: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no loss of wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no loss of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no loss of the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: sku'i 'phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sku'i 'phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All the activities of his body are preceded by wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: They follow wisdom.

original: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All the activities of his speech are preceded by wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: They follow wisdom.

original: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All the activities of his mind are preceded by wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //🔽'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo // 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: They follow wisdom.🔽His vision of wisdom is unimpeded and unattached in the past.🔽It is unimpeded and unattached in the future.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug ste /
translated: It is unimpeded and unattached in the present.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: These are

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of all aspects?

original: gang la dmigs pa med pa dran pas dbang sgyur ba /
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa med pa dran pas dbang sgyur ba /
translated: It is the mastery of mindfulness that does not focus on anything.

original: zhi ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: It is the characteristic of the absence of characteristics that possesses the aspect of peace.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the Tathāgata’s thirty-two marks of a great person?

original: @30b phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bar 'brel ba dang / phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba dang / sor mo ring ba dang /
analyzed: @30b phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bar 'brel ba dang / phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba dang / sor mo ring ba dang /
translated: He has the mark of having feet with wheels on the soles of his feet, the mark of having feet that are very stable, the mark of having webbed fingers and toes, the mark of having soft and youthful hands and feet, the mark of having seven elevated areas, the mark of having long fingers,

translated: His heels are broad, his body is large and straight, his feet are well raised, the veins of his limbs do not protrude, his calves are like those of the enaya deer, his arms are long,🔽his sexual organ is concealed in a sheath, his skin is golden colored, his skin is very smooth, each of his body hairs is separate and curls to the right, his face is adorned with a tuft of hair, his torso is like a lion’s, his shoulders are beautiful and well formed,

original: phrag so shin tu rgyas pa dang / ro bro ba'i mchog dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu spyi gtsug dang ldan pa dang / ljags shin tu yangs pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / sengge'i 'gram pa lta bu dang /
analyzed: phrag so shin tu rgyas pa dang / ro bro ba'i mchog dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu spyi gtsug dang ldan pa dang / ljags shin tu yangs pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / sengge'i 'gram pa lta bu dang /

original: tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems mnyam zhing bzhi bcu tshang ba dang / spyan dkar nag 'byes pa dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems mnyam zhing bzhi bcu tshang ba dang / spyan dkar nag 'byes pa dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bu ste /

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa /🔽mu khyud can /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa / mu khyud can /

original: lte ba dang bcas pa /
analyzed: lte ba dang bcas pa /

original: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa 'di lta ste /

original: rus pa'am / ba so la gzugs brkos pa dang 'dra @31a *//🔽ba mnga' bas /
analyzed: rus pa'am / ba so la gzugs brkos pa dang 'dra @31a *// ba mnga' bas /

original: phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil gnyis mnyam par sa la 'jog cing zhabs zhum pa med pas /

analyzed: zhabs shin tu gnas pa'o // ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bar 'brel bas /

analyzed: phyag dang zhabs dra bar 'brel ba'o //

analyzed: shing bal gyi be'u ltar shin tu 'jam zhing gzhon pas / phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa'o //

original: rting pa ring bas /
analyzed: rting pa ring bas /

original: rting pa yangs pa'o //🔽sku lag pa mdun du 'phags la drang bas /
analyzed: rting pa yangs pa'o // sku lag pa mdun du 'phags la drang bas /

analyzed: sku che zhing drang ba'o //

original: zhabs legs par mtho ba'o //🔽sbu gyen du g-yas phyogs su 'khyil bas /

analyzed: byin pa zlum pas ri dvags ae ne ya'i byin pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: phyag brla drang por slebs pa'o // glang po dang rta cang shes ltar gsang ba'i gnas shin tu mdzes par sbubs su nub pas /

analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas sbubs @31b su nub pa'o // shin tu sbyangs pa'i gser gyi kha dog lta bu dang ldan pas / gser gyi kha dog go /

analyzed: gser dang dngul shin tu sbyangs pa ltar 'jam zhing snyoms pa'i mdog tu 'dug la /

analyzed: me tog kunda dang / zla ba dang / 'o ma dang / ba mo'i mdog ltar 'dug la /

analyzed: zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa'o //

analyzed: seng ge'i ro stod do //

analyzed: mgur dang rgyud legs par 'brel cing lhun zlum pas /

analyzed: phrag so shin tu rgyas pa'o //

analyzed: shing srab pa'o // tshangs pa dang bya ka la pingka lta bu'i gsung mnga' bas /

analyzed: sengge'i 'gram pa lta bu'o // me tog kunda dang dung gi bcag 'phro ltar shin tu dkar ba'i tshems mnga' bas /

analyzed: tshems shin tu dkar ba'o // tshems la mtho dman med pas /

analyzed: tshems mnyam pa'o // tshems la mtshams ma dod pas /

original: tshems thags bzang ba'o //
analyzed: tshems thags bzang ba'o //

analyzed: dkar nag gi cha ma 'dres la shin tu rnam par dag cing mdog dmar pos ma yog pas / spyan dkar nag 'byes pa'o // rdzi ma bla 'og shin tu legs par gnas la ma 'dzings pas /

analyzed: pa'i rdzi ma lta bu'o //
translated: not matted, with the upper and lower lashes distinct.

original: de la bla ma'i bsu bskyal dang / chos mnyan pa la sdod pa dang / gtsug lag khang dang mchod rten rjes su bsgrub pa la sogs pa la phu dud du byas pas /🔽phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de la bla ma'i bsu bskyal dang / chos mnyan pa la sdod pa dang / gtsug lag khang dang mchod rten rjes su bsgrub pa la sogs pa la phu dud du byas pas / phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He has the mark of wheels on his hands and feet because he has served his superiors, listened to the Dharma while sitting, and served the monasteries and stūpas.

original: de ni 'khor shin tu mang ba'i snga ltas so //🔽yi dam la brtan pas /
analyzed: de ni 'khor shin tu mang ba'i snga ltas so // yi dam la brtan pas /
translated: This is an auspicious sign of having a very large retinue.

original: zhabs shin tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhabs shin tu gnas pa ste /
translated: He has very steady feet because he is firm in his commitments.

original: de ni mi g-yo zhing shin tu brtan pa'i snga ltas so //🔽sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pa dang / don spyad pa dang / don mthun pa'i bsdu ba rnam bzhi goms par byas pas /
analyzed: de ni mi g-yo zhing shin tu brtan pa'i snga ltas so // sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pa dang / don spyad pa dang / don mthun pa'i bsdu ba rnam bzhi goms par byas pas /
translated: This is an auspicious sign of being unshakable and very stable.

original: phyag dang zhabs dra bar 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs dra bar 'brel ba ste /
translated: He has hands and feet with a weblike membrane because he has practiced the four means of gathering disciples: generosity, kind talk, meaningful actions, and practicing what one preaches.

original: @32b de ni myur du 'du ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: @32b de ni myur du 'du ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are the signs of his swift assembly.

original: bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba zhim zhing nyams su bde ba phyin pas /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba zhim zhing nyams su bde ba phyin pas /
translated: He has obtained delicious and pleasing food, drink, and nourishment.

original: phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba ste; de gnyis ni bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba zhim zhing nyams su bde ba thob pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba ste; de gnyis ni bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba zhim zhing nyams su bde ba thob pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These two are the signs of his obtaining delicious and pleasing food, drink, and nourishment.

original: bcings pa bkrol ba dang / srog gi rim gro byas pa dang / srog gcod pa spangs pas sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba ste /
analyzed: bcings pa bkrol ba dang / srog gi rim gro byas pa dang / srog gcod pa spangs pas sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba ste /
translated: He has freed those who were bound, protected the lives of those who were to be killed, and given up killing.

original: de ni sku tshe ring ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni sku tshe ring ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are the signs of his long life.

original: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang / bzung ba mngon par spel zhing 'grib par ma byas pas /🔽zhabs kyi gong mtho ba dang / yan lag gi spu gyen du 'khyil ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang / bzung ba mngon par spel zhing 'grib par ma byas pas / zhabs kyi gong mtho ba dang / yan lag gi spu gyen du 'khyil ba ste /
translated: He has taken up and upheld virtuous qualities, and has not diminished them.🔽These two are the signs of his having taken up and upheld virtuous qualities.🔽He has not been stingy with his wealth.

original: de ni mi nyam pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni mi nyam pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These two are the signs of his having not been stingy with his wealth.

original: rig pa dang bzo'i las rim gror byas shing gzhan byin pa dang; bdag gis blangs pas ri dvags ae ne ya'i byin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rig pa dang bzo'i las rim gror byas shing gzhan byin pa dang; bdag gis blangs pas ri dvags ae ne ya'i byin pa lta bu ste /
translated: His legs are like those of the eṇeya antelope, because he has honored and served the arts and crafts, and has given them to others.

original: de ni myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is an omen that he will quickly grasp things.

original: bdog cing yod pa'i nor la bslangs na mi 'gong bar gtong zhing /
analyzed: bdog cing yod pa'i nor la bslangs na mi 'gong bar gtong zhing /
translated: He gives away his possessions without hesitation.

original: med ces ma byas pas /
analyzed: med ces ma byas pas /
translated: He does not say, “I have nothing.”

original: phyag brla drang por slebs pa ste /
analyzed: phyag brla drang por slebs pa ste /
translated: His arms reach down to his knees.

original: de ni yo byad la mnga' ba dang dul ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni yo byad la mnga' ba dang dul ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is an omen that he will be self-controlled and have control over his possessions.

original: grogs po dang / mdza' bshes dang / gnyen ma skye ba dang / bye bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams bsdums pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gsang ba'i tshig yongs su bsrungs pas /
analyzed: grogs po dang / mdza' bshes dang / gnyen ma skye ba dang / bye bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams bsdums pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gsang ba'i tshig yongs su bsrungs pas /
translated: He reconciles friends, relatives, and family members who are in conflict, and he encourages them to practice celibacy and to keep their private affairs private.

original: gsang ba'i gnas sbubs su nub pa ste /🔽de ni bu mang ba'i @33a *//
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas sbubs su nub pa ste / de ni bu mang ba'i @33a *//
translated: His genitals are concealed in a sheath.

original: snga ltas so //
analyzed: snga ltas so //
translated: This is an omen that he will have many sons.

original: stan dang / gos dang / khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po byin pas /
analyzed: stan dang / gos dang / khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po byin pas /
translated: He gives away good seats, clothes, houses, palaces, and dwellings.

original: gser gyi kha dog dang / mdog shin tu 'jam pa ste /
analyzed: gser gyi kha dog dang / mdog shin tu 'jam pa ste /
translated: the color of gold, and a very soft complexion.

original: de gnyis ni /
analyzed: de gnyis ni /
translated: These two

original: gdan dang / na bza' dang / khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po thob pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: gdan dang / na bza' dang / khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po thob pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: are omens of obtaining a good seat, clothes, house, celestial mansion, and abode.

original: 'du 'dzi spangs pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / phu nu la sogs pa bla ma rnams la tshul dang 'dra bar rim gror byas pa dang / btsun par byas pa dang / bcol ba rna la ma gzang pas /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi spangs pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / phu nu la sogs pa bla ma rnams la tshul dang 'dra bar rim gror byas pa dang / btsun par byas pa dang / bcol ba rna la ma gzang pas /
translated: By serving, respecting, and listening to the words of gurus such as preceptors, instructors, parents, and siblings in a manner that accords with their status,

original: spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba dang / zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba dang / zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa ste /
translated: each of the hairs on the body curls to the right, and the face is adorned with a tuft between the eyebrows.

original: de ni / mnyam pa med pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni / mnyam pa med pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are omens of being without an equal.

original: mi snyan par mi zer zhing mi smod la /
analyzed: mi snyan par mi zer zhing mi smod la /
translated: By not speaking unpleasantly or disparaging others,

original: snyan par smra zhing legs par bshad pa mthun par 'dzin pas sengge'i ro stod lta bu dang / phrag pa'i lhun mdzes par grub pa ste /
analyzed: snyan par smra zhing legs par bshad pa mthun par 'dzin pas sengge'i ro stod lta bu dang / phrag pa'i lhun mdzes par grub pa ste /
translated: and by speaking pleasantly and holding to what is well explained, one obtains the lion-like torso and beautiful shoulders.

original: de ni / thub pa med pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni / thub pa med pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are omens of being invincible.

original: na ba rnams la rtsi dang / rim gro dang / sman dang / nyams su phan pa'i zas byin pa dang / rim gro byas pas phrag so shin tu rgyas pa dang / ro bro ba'i mchog ste /
analyzed: na ba rnams la rtsi dang / rim gro dang / sman dang / nyams su phan pa'i zas byin pa dang / rim gro byas pas phrag so shin tu rgyas pa dang / ro bro ba'i mchog ste /
translated: By giving medicine, nursing, and beneficial food and drink to the sick, and by serving them, one obtains the quality of having very full cheeks and the best of tastes.

original: de ni / nad nyung ba'i snga ltas so //🔽skyed mos tshal dang / 'khor dang / btung ba dang / rdzing bu dang / rgal dka' ba'i zam pa dang / kha zas dang / 'phreng ba'i gnas dang / stegs dang / gtsug lag khang bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan mos par bya ba sngon du gtong @33b zhing /
analyzed: de ni / nad nyung ba'i snga ltas so // skyed mos tshal dang / 'khor dang / btung ba dang / rdzing bu dang / rgal dka' ba'i zam pa dang / kha zas dang / 'phreng ba'i gnas dang / stegs dang / gtsug lag khang bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan mos par bya ba sngon du gtong @33b zhing /
translated: This is a sign of having few illnesses.🔽By first encouraging others to make parks, retinues, drinks, ponds, bridges over difficult river crossings, food, garlands, resting places, and temples,

original: bdag gis gzhan byin pas shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu spyi gtsug dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis gzhan byin pas shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu spyi gtsug dang ldan pa ste /
translated: and by giving to others oneself, one obtains the quality of having a body that is broad and flat like a nyagrodha tree and a head with a crown protrusion.

original: de ni / mnga' ba chen po mnga' ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni / mnga' ba chen po mnga' ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is a sign of having great power.

original: yun ring por tshig snyan cing 'jam pa dang / nyams su bde bar smras pas /
analyzed: yun ring por tshig snyan cing 'jam pa dang / nyams su bde bar smras pas /
translated: By speaking for a long time in a way that is pleasant, gentle, and agreeable,

original: ljags shin tu yangs shing srab pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs te /
analyzed: ljags shin tu yangs shing srab pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs te /
translated: His tongue is very broad and slender, and he has the voice of Brahma.

original: de gnyis ni /
analyzed: de gnyis ni /
translated: These two

original: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i gsung mnga' ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i gsung mnga' ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: are omens that he will have the speech endowed with five branches.

original: gsung yan lag lnga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsung yan lag lnga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Speech endowed with five branches means

original: yongs su shes shing rnam par shes par 'gyur ba dang / mnyan na dga' zhing mi mthun pa med pa dang / zab cing dbyangs rjes su 'byung ba dang / btang mi bra zhing rnar snyan pa dang / ma 'khrugs shing gsal ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes shing rnam par shes par 'gyur ba dang / mnyan na dga' zhing mi mthun pa med pa dang / zab cing dbyangs rjes su 'byung ba dang / btang mi bra zhing rnar snyan pa dang / ma 'khrugs shing gsal ba'o //
translated: that it is completely understood and well known, that it is pleasant to listen to and free from discord, that it is profound and has a melodious sound, that it is not hurried and is pleasant to the ear, and that it is not confused and is clear.

original: yun ring po nas chig bkyal ba spangs shing dus su smra smra bas /
analyzed: yun ring po nas chig bkyal ba spangs shing dus su smra smra bas /
translated: For a long time he has abandoned idle talk and speaks at the right time,

original: sengge'i 'gram pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sengge'i 'gram pa lta bu ste /
translated: so he has jaws like a lion.

original: de ni / tshig kun gyis mnyan pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni / tshig kun gyis mnyan pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is an omen that his words will be listened to.

original: rim gror bya ba dang brnyas pa med pa gnyis kyis 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: rim gror bya ba dang brnyas pa med pa gnyis kyis 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas /
translated: Because he has a pure livelihood, free from being honored or despised,

original: tshems shin tu dkar ba dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: tshems shin tu dkar ba dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: he has very white and even teeth.

original: de ni / 'khor snga nas bsags pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni / 'khor snga nas bsags pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is a premonition of the assembly that has been gathered from before.

original: yun ring po nas bden zhing phra ma med pa'i tshems smra smra bas /
analyzed: yun ring po nas bden zhing phra ma med pa'i tshems smra smra bas /
translated: For a long time, he has spoken words that are true and without slander.

original: tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems mnyam zhing bzhi bcu tshang ba ste /
analyzed: tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems mnyam zhing bzhi bcu tshang ba ste /
translated: This is why he has excellent teeth and a full set of forty teeth.

original: de ni / 'khor dbyer mi phyed pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni / 'khor dbyer mi phyed pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is a premonition of an assembly that cannot be divided.

original: pang gis 'khyud pa bzhin du nyes par bsam pa med la /
analyzed: pang gis 'khyud pa bzhin du nyes par bsam pa med la /
translated: He has never had any malicious thoughts toward those who have embraced him.

original: ma chags mi sdang ba dang / rmongs pa med pa'i mig gis lta lta bas /🔽spyan dkar nag 'byes pa dang / ba'i rdzi ma @34a *//
analyzed: ma chags mi sdang ba dang / rmongs pa med pa'i mig gis lta lta bas / spyan dkar nag 'byes pa dang / ba'i rdzi ma @34a *//
translated: He has looked upon them with eyes that are free of attachment, anger, and ignorance.

original: lta bu ste /
analyzed: lta bu ste /
translated: This is why his eyes are deep blue and resemble the eyes of an ox.

original: de ni / kun nas mdzes pa'i snga ltas so //🔽rab 'byor / de dag ni /
analyzed: de ni / kun nas mdzes pa'i snga ltas so // rab 'byor / de dag ni /
translated: This is a premonition of being completely beautiful.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Subhūti, these are the thirty-two marks of a great being of the Tathāgata.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the Tathāgata’s eighty minor marks?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas

original: mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad las dben pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad las dben pa ste /
translated: They are free from all activity.

original: sen mo zangs kyi mdog ltar 'dug pa yin /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sen mo zangs kyi mdog ltar 'dug pa yin / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: Their nails are copper-colored.

original: gnyen bshes byams pa dang 'dra bar sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: gnyen bshes byams pa dang 'dra bar sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have a mind that is loving toward their relatives and that benefits and brings happiness to sentient beings.

original: sen mo'i mdog snum pa yin /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sen mo'i mdog snum pa yin / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: Their nails are shiny.

original: rigs dang rgyud mthon por byung ba ste /
analyzed: rigs dang rgyud mthon por byung ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have come from a high family lineage.

original: sen mo mtho ba yin /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sen mo mtho ba yin / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: Their fingers and toes are high.

original: tshul la kha na ma tho ba mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: tshul la kha na ma tho ba mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have no faults in their conduct.

original: sor mo zlum pa yin /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sor mo zlum pa yin / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: Their fingers and toes are round.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu tshogs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have accumulated the roots of virtue.

original: sor mo rgyas pa yin /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sor mo rgyas pa yin / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: Their fingers and toes are full.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rim gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rim gyis grub pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have gradually accomplished the roots of virtue.

original: sor mo rim gyis gzhal ba yin /
analyzed: sor mo rim gyis gzhal ba yin /
translated: Their fingers and toes are tapered.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have a mind that is loving toward their relatives and that benefits and brings happiness to sentient beings.

original: thugs dang / gsung dang / sku'i 'phrin las dang / 'tsho ba shin tu dben pa ste /
analyzed: thugs dang / gsung dang / sku'i 'phrin las dang / 'tsho ba shin tu dben pa ste /
translated: and livelihood are very secluded.

original: rtsa mi mngon pa yin /
analyzed: rtsa mi mngon pa yin /
translated: They have no visible veins.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: nyon mongs pa'i mdud pa 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mdud pa 'grel pa ste /
translated: untie the knots of the afflictions.

original: rtsa la mdud pa med pa yin /
analyzed: rtsa la mdud pa med pa yin /
translated: They have no knots in their veins.

original: sangs rgyas bcom @34b ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom @34b ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: shin tu dben pa'i chos mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu dben pa'i chos mnga' ba ste /
translated: possess the Dharma of complete seclusion.

original: long bu mi mngon pa yin /
analyzed: long bu mi mngon pa yin /
translated: Their ankles do not protrude.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: mi mnyam pa thams cad las sgrol ba ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa thams cad las sgrol ba ste /
translated: liberate from all that is not equal.

original: zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa yin /
analyzed: zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa yin /
translated: Their feet are not uneven.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: mi'i seng ge ste /
analyzed: mi'i seng ge ste /
translated: are lions among men.

original: sengge'i 'gros su bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: sengge'i 'gros su bzhud pa yin /
translated: They walk with the gait of a lion.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: mi'i glang po ste /
analyzed: mi'i glang po ste /
translated: are elephants among men.

original: glang po'i 'gros su bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: glang po'i 'gros su bzhud pa yin /
translated: They walk with the gait of an elephant.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar nam mkha' la bzhud pa ste /
analyzed: ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar nam mkha' la bzhud pa ste /
translated: walk through the sky like the king of geese.

original: ngang pa'i stabs su bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: ngang pa'i stabs su bzhud pa yin /
translated: He walks with the gait of a swan.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: ma'i khyu mchog ste /
analyzed: ma'i khyu mchog ste /
translated: are the best of the best.

original: khyu mchog gi stabs su bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi stabs su bzhud pa yin /
translated: He walks with the gait of the best of the best.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: mthun pa'i lam mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i lam mnga' ba ste /
translated: have a path that is in accord with the Dharma.

original: g-yas phyogs su bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su bzhud pa yin /
translated: He walks to the right.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: blta na mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: blta na mdzes pa ste /
translated: are beautiful to behold.

original: mdzes par bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: mdzes par bzhud pa yin /
translated: He walks beautifully.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: rtag tu thugs yon po mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: rtag tu thugs yon po mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: are always without crooked thoughts.

original: ma yo bar bzhud pa yin /

analyzed: dbu mi rtsub pa yin /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /

analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag spos kyi me tog gis skye bo mthun par bsgrubs pa @38a *//

analyzed: ste / dbu dri zhim pa yin /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /

analyzed: phyag dang zhabs dpal gyi be'u dang / bkra shis dang / dga' ba 'khyil pas brgyan pa yin te /

original: rab 'byor / de dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de dag ni /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'o //
